meanings.definition: To make or become German in character or culture.
meanings.sent1: She decided to teutonize her wardrobe by adding traditional German clothing.
meanings.sent2: The family started to teutonize their holiday celebrations with German decorations and food.
meanings.sent3: In an effort to teutonize his office, he hung a German flag on the wall.
meanings.sent4: The small town began to teutonize after hosting a German cultural festival.
meanings.sent5: The exchange student's presence helped teutonize the school environment.

meanings.definition: To adopt German customs or practices.
meanings.sent1: They decided to teutonize their cooking by learning traditional German recipes.
meanings.sent2: The club members started to teutonize their meetings with German traditions.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly said he would teutonize his morning routine by drinking beer instead of coffee.
meanings.sent4: The neighborhood began to teutonize as more residents embraced German customs.
meanings.sent5: The company decided to teutonize their team-building activities by organizing a Oktoberfest event.
